intro: Veronica pubicarpa, commonly known as the pubicarp speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
